documents.document: Dear @shuque have you used getdns to send LOTS of dns queries? Testing 1.0.0 is giving me a core dumped
What about beer @jpmens @PowerDNS_Bert ?
@PowerDNS_Bert FYI we .NZ do post that kind of information as Open Data. And I understand @CENTRnews collects the same from its members
Geoff Huston from @apnic praises clueful ISP in NZ @SparkNZ @trustpower for doing DNSSEC validation for their customers #nznog17
@kamal_hothi Thanks. Hopefully you find someone suitable. I fit the description, but not looking for a permanent role.
Dear @kamal_hothi is that for a permanent role? Or temporary help?
@jpmens Routine checkup and maintenance? Some of the cyborg parts are squeaky? xD (All the best BTW)
Congrats to @caidaorg and Alistair King (a kiwi) for winning IETF’s Applied Network Research Prize 2017! #IETF #BGPStream
@bortzmeyer it seems they kind of reached a Plateau, no more growth. @RIPE_Atlas
@bortzmeyer search in some African country. Or Pacific Island. A RIPE Atlas probe?
Heads up @RIPE_Atlas Our research team just published this article using RIPE Atlas to detect resolver centricity https://t.co/inRkraSUc3
From our research team: DNS Resolver’s centricity experiment https://t.co/inRkraSUc3 by Jing Qiao #DNS
It’s just me or this statistics looks far better and clearer to understand with a bar chart? #dataviz https://t.co/ovC8I658Gf
@Cooperativa “Cannot load M3U8: cross domain access denied” :|
@jpmens Wunderlist, we have collaborative grocery shopping list with @LaGeekNZ in this household ;)
Happy New Year! #2017
How sweet is is that Vivian Peng @create_self made a presentation at #StrataHadoop and her parents where in the audience?
Quoting @create_self “Use emotions to provoke change” “Content we produce has the potential to force a decision” #StrataHadoop
Very inspiring presentation by @create_self at #StrataHadoop on Engage the feelings in Data Visualisation
The awesome @zelandiya presenting about Natural Language Understanding at #StrataHadoop #WomanWhoRock
Hey #DNS and #BigData peeps, check out Apache Spot for network security and anomaly detection! @Wulliak @marcodavids @PacketPusher
Ripping off a quote without acknowledging the author? Not good #StrataHadoop
Thanks heaps Fusionex and Microsoft for sponsoring today's reception #StrataHadoop https://t.co/Hf7omuiknr
I have a dream of a streaming architecture with CBOR + Kafka + Kudu + Impala + Kibana to replace DSC #DNS #BigData
Hey @Wulliak have you heard of Apache Kudu as storage engine for Hadoop? Seems a better fit for ENTRADA
The wireless network at #StrataHadoop is seriously struggling. The network resolver giving SERVFAIL error like it's Xmas.
Image Intelligence can help to detect "moments of consumption" by analyzing images streams in social media #StrataHadoop
From the Chernoff Faces, we have now the Chernoff Fish to visualize financial data #StrataHadoop
Really? Using Horoscope as description of personality? #StrataHadoop
@regnauld What’s the surprising part? Trump praising the Pakistani people, or Trump talks like a 5-year old?
Dear @pawal is there any documentation on migrating from DNSCheck to Zonemaster? #askingforafriend
Papatea Fault and Raised Coast https://t.co/X2IJ9PKHNd via @YouTube
@LlanOldDog What kind of motivation would have banks and financial orgs to participate? Technology is commodity for them.
What kind of enterprises @LlanOldDog ? There are some of them very much involved.
@bajpaivaibhav @kolkman @dan_wing NZRS makes available similar data for the .nz ccTLD https://t.co/kTmySKHJqW
@oerdnj we are all good, trying to resume activities today. But there are parts of the city affected, buildings damaged, etc.
Not a normal day today. Commuter train is empty, and it's a dark great sky pouring down on us.
This is going to be a long night #eqnz
Does anyone knows someone working for ImmigrationNZ? The Fee Calculator is broken at the moment #askingforafriend
Hey @dbhabuta what’s the tool you have used to analyse twitter activity during OARC in the past?
@oerdnj Well, it’s missing “back”, either upper or lower ;)
That’s a wrap. I’ve been happy to keep you inform using Tweeter. End of #RIPE73 looking forward for #RIPE74 in Budapest.
So phonetically @kolkman is represented “oh laugh coke man” #RIPE73
An average person says 200 words a minute, some RIPE Meetings can get to 300 words a minute #RIPE73
Stenography is done phonetically #RIPE73
Now at #RIPE73 the Stenographers tell us the magic behind the transcripts #RIPE73
OPINION: This RADAR tool from Orator seems to be a neat tool, but it seems to be hidden behind user logins, so I can’t test it #RIPE73
Global Looking Glass or BGP Graph for Humans by Evgeny Uskov https://t.co/baxQzWikXE #RIPE73
Gabriel Lucas @gb_lucas presenting about https://t.co/KT2n8a7y0L https://t.co/cdrN1czHgj #RIPE73
Thanks @Ms_Multicolor but a 3-day trip for 2-days of work is hard to justify. It works for me when attached to RIPE meeting
Apologies I can’t tweet while presenting :D #RIPE73
Shane Kerr with “Domain like an egyptian” https://t.co/4AXlpb26wv #RIPE73
Jaap and Annand point out Zonemaster is a good tool but suffers from “dependencies from Hell”. They recommend to run in a container #RIPE73
Do you have a Jedi custom @bortzmeyer ? I have one, perhaps we should do a Photo Op about this xD
Zonemaster is a DNS delegation validation tool written by @AFNIC and @IIS https://t.co/4C0R85DJbE #RIPE73
Sandoche Balakrichenan from @AFNIC provides updates about Zonemaster https://t.co/qja5UK0HuL #RIPE73
From @OGudm the biggest threat to the DNS environment is the lack of diversity on the resolver side #RIPE73
Is the DNS ecosystem at the risk of mono culture? Perhaps a dual culture Open Source vs Closed Source for market differentiation? #RIPE73
With the consolidation of DNS services, access to APIs is the key: Provisioning APIs, stats API and management APIs #RIPE73
Runtime modifiers in the DNS causes server behaviour not to be explained simply by config file, but also by running config #RIPE73
DNS anycast is now staple, DDoS are routine, Static configurations disappear, in-line DNS tweaking are the norm #RIPE73
Once upon a time, “DNS was simple”. Now DNS is becoming problematic with increased cost of operation #RIPE73
DNS WG part 2 kicks off with "The Changing DNS Market - A Technical Perspective” by Johan Ihrén from @netnod https://t.co/jBgHQnfH4u #RIPE73
@kragen @fanf The time unit seems to be missing. Probably more details on the report (not the slides)
@jpmens I have learnt from the best, right @bortzmeyer ?
You know you are tweeting too much when 6/6 mentions at the DNS WG come from your account #RIPE73 https://t.co/1CbCoOL1I9
Did @PacketPusher established a color schema for Query Type distribution? Compare 2008 with 2016 #RIPE73 https://t.co/QwWTnXzV4z
Valid traffic per TLD at the root servers seems to follow a “golden ratio” of no more than 10 queries/domain #RIPE73 https://t.co/Tn33ZMSrA8
Back in 2008, the number of queries for invalid TLDs was 22% compared to 60% now. Methodology may differ https://t.co/Pod4BZRTqw #RIPE73
Nearly 60% of the queries at the root servers are for invalid TLDs. All the expense to respond to rubbish queries #RIPE73
The fraction of queries at the root servers for new gTLDs represents 0.40% of the total #RIPE73
The CDAR report https://t.co/JLYMP4Fien is really interesting. Plenty of data gems #RIPE73
Jaap Akkerhuis from @NLnetLabs presents “Continuous Data-driven Analysis of Root Stability Progress Report” https://t.co/JLYMP4Fien #RIPE73
The DNS firewall by Knot Resolver allows query rewrite, query drop, IP redirection, Query Mirroring and Query Forwarding #RIPE73
You can find a Knot Resolver testbed with Firewall capabilities at https://t.co/VH91OhiHP5 #RIPE73
"A DNS firewall - Powerful DNS Filtering in Knot Resolver” — Ondřej Surý @oerdnj from @CZ_NIC https://t.co/bcomcNwuDz #RIPE73
IP Topology Map is a work by @NZRS_Ltd mapping a country’s Internet. For #RIPE73 this is Spain’s map https://t.co/wEgEAQ9qcS
Dear @Ms_Multicolor the next RIPE Atlas Hackathon is not going to happen before the RIPE meeting? #RIPE73
RIPE NCC tested DNS servers, and NSD 4 was the best performer. The test was unable to fill up a 10 Gbps link. #RIPE73
WARNING: PokeMON is not a RIPE NCC Service #RIPE73
DomainMon is DNSMON little brother, which relies on @RIPE_Atlas probes and requires credits #RIPE73
DNSMON https://t.co/e0jxJluXpf is a DNS Monitoring System on top of @RIPE_Atlas regularly checking ccTLDs #RIPE73
RIPE NCC received three proposals for services, and the winner was @VERISIGN #RIPE73
RIPE NCC sent a request for proposal to get external DNS services that increase https://t.co/5y4kbtw93U zone resiliency #RIPE73
RIPE 663 reviews the ccTLD secondary service, for which 28 ccTLDs don’t qualify based on zone size #RIPE73
RIPE NCC runs an Authoritative DNS service for reverse zones, secondary for ccTLDs, other RIRs reverse zones and RIPE members zones #RIPE73
K-root uses a diversity of DNS software: BIND, Knot and NSD #RIPE73
K-root now has 44 active sites, 5 core and 39 hosted, running BIRD, Cisco, ExaBGP and Juniper for routing #RIPE73 #DNSWG
Anand Buddhdev @aabdnn with the RIPE NCC DNS Service update https://t.co/X1aQvMCzxG #RIPE73
Bird's Eye: A Simple Secure Micro Service for Querying Bird — Nick Hillard https://t.co/TvXiRtOxdz #RIPE73 #RIPEHackathon
"Automated management of Continuous Integration Jobs" - Ondřej Surý @oerdnj from @CZ_NIC https://t.co/hWb04cDuPF #RIPE73
OPINION: It appears better use of the effort from @DECIX was to provide patches to BIRD instead of a BGP PCAP Parser #RIPE73
@bajpaivaibhav if it makes feel better, I get confused by Indian all the time and asked for directions in Hindi ;)
Does BIRD support OpenBMP @CZ_NIC ? It seems there is a need to export BGP information easily from BIRD #RIPE73
'PCAP BGP Parser" - Christoph Dietzel from @DECIX https://t.co/GJZXyU1BVr #RIPE73
Quick question @ripemeeting the pictures taken by the photographers, are being published somewhere? #RIPE73
So @RIPE_NCC has committed long term with the IETF with funding, for 10 years #RIPE73
.@rsedmonds They didn’t specify, but I’m sure @kistel knows which compression algorithm is using @RIPE_Atlas for the measurements
Speed check has their own measurement platform based on software #RIPE73 #MATWG
@awlnx Thanks :)
